title.narrative: Promoting Reduction of and Improved Operational Response to Gender-based Violence (GBV) through Camp Management and Site Planning – Phase VII

description.narrative: Since 2015, IOM has been implementing a global project on Gender-Based Violence (GBV) prevention and risk mitigation under the Safe from the Start Initiative (SftS) supported by the US Bureau of Population, Refugees and Migration (PRM). The six phases of the project have allowed IOM to fulfil key commitments made under the 2016-2020 Roadmap of the global Call to Action on Protection from GBV in Emergencies. Building on the strategic priorities identified in the previous phases, the objectives of Phase VII will be to: 1) Continue addressing gaps identified across key technical sectors where IOM is active, including camp coordination and camp management, shelter and settlements, water, sanitation and hygiene, and health, and strengthen further capacity building initiatives; 2) Foster stronger coordination and collective action on GBV; 3) Pursue the institutionalization and operationalization of IOM’s Institutional Framework on addressing GBV in Crisis; and 4) Continue to provide assistance to in-country Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse stakeholders at leadership and technical levels.
